course.title: Biological Dynamics
course.description: Develops theoretical basis for modeling and quantitative analysis of biological problems. Emphasis on contemporary research topics, including molecular, cellular and tissue dynamics; development and differentiation; signal- and mechano-transduction; individuals, populations and environments.
course.prerequisites: Knowledge of differential equations and statistical mechanics at undergraduate level.
course.notes: It is suggested that students may wish to take AP215 when this course is bracketed. May not be taken for credit in addition to AP215.
